sect1.title: Required Data for Installing the System
sect1.para: The &sls; part of the installation requires the following data for every physical server:

listitem.para: Master password for the system installation (root password)

sect1.para: Depending on the SAP application you want to install, further parameters are required, for example, an SAP System ID or System T-Shirt Size.

sect1.title: Overview of the Installation Workflow
sect1.para: The installation workflow can be separated into steps:

listitem.para: &sapwiz;, part 1: Copying all required SAP media to the local disk or selecting a shared storage medium to use.
&sapwiz;, part 2: Collecting all parameters for the actual installation by querying the user interactively.

sect1.para: Most of these steps do not need to be run immediately after each other which allows for flexibility in how you install systems. This means that you can prepare a single installation as a first step and then continue from there. For example:

listitem.para: Install the operating system (&sls;), copy SAP media, and collect SAP installation parameters.

sect1.para: Then, create disk images, copy them to other systems, and adjust SAP installation parameters. Finally, finish the installation on each machine individually.
